ANU.name: LILI XIANG
ANU.colleges: College of Arts and Social Sciences
expertise: Urban And Regional Studies Excl. Planning
interest: Lili is a geographer and demographer whose current project is focused on supporting Australian Capital Territory (ACT) Education Directorate to enhance its student demand model projection capability. As an interdisciplinary researcher, she has wide-ranging research interests in quantitative geography, demography, spatial analysis and modelling:Integrated school enrolment modellingUrban infill studySpatial analysisEducation inequalityUrban studies and migrationGeodemographics Multilevel modelling
project: Integrated School Enrollment Modelling ACT Education Directorate/ School of Demography, ANU

publication.title: Do residents of affordable housing communities in China suffer from relative accessibility deprivation? A case study of Nanjing
publication.source: Cities: the international journal of urban policy and planning, vol. 90, pp. 141-156

publication.title: geodemographic classification of susb-districts to identify education inequality in Central Beijing

publication.source: Applied Research in Quality of Life, vol. Online
